intro: Mapouria viguieri, commonly known as the Madagascar lily, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces large, fleshy leaves and has a bulbous stem that stores water, adapting it to its arid habitat. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes.
